definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Clearly Liuzhou needs to fill a sizable gap, including rebuilding and upgrading existing public toilets.
sentences.chinese: 因此，柳州需要進行公廁的重建和改造。

sentences.english: Public toilets will be rated from one to five stars.
sentences.chinese: 公廁評定將從一星級一直到五星級。

sentences.english: The public restroom is a delicate topic of conversation for many people.
sentences.chinese: 對很多人來說公廁是一個微妙的話題。

sentences.english: A luxury public toilet recently opened its door to Nanjing residents free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 日前，南京一座豪華公廁正式免費對公衆開放。

sentences.english: It is better than being charged the way CMCC wring our fees for communication.
sentences.chinese: 在中國上公廁比被中國移動收話費要好的多。

sentences.english: There is chatting service provided in the public toilet, is it ridiculous or the creative?
sentences.chinese: 公廁裏推出陪聊服務是創新還是雷人？

sentences.english: Public toilets will be rated from one to five stars。
sentences.chinese: 公廁評定將從一星級一直到五星級。

sentences.english: One night he awoke with diarrhea and stumbled to the public outhouse.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，他被腹瀉弄醒，跌跌撞撞地去外屋公廁。

definition: public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
